name: Campaign
desc: The response to a request to create and fetch campaigns.

items.name: adamId
items.desc: Your unique App Store app identifier. You can obtain your app adamId through Search for iOS Apps.You can use the EQUALS and IN selector Condition operators with Find Campaigns.

items.name: adChannelType
items.desc: The channel type of ad in a campaign. See AdChannelType for value descriptions.See also the supplySources parameter description.You can use the EQUALS selector Condition operator with Find Campaigns and Get Campaign-Level Reports.

items.name: billingEvent
items.desc: The type of billing event for a campaign.See BillingEventType for value descriptions.See also the supplySources parameter description.

items.name: budgetAmount
items.desc: The total budget amount available to the campaign. You can’t reduce a budgetAmount after you start a campaign.When you set a budget, your campaign runs until you exhaust your budget, pause your campaign, or reach the scheduled end date.You can use the EQUALS, LESS_THAN, and GREATER_THAN selector Condition operators with Find Campaigns.This field is updatable.

items.name: budgetOrders
items.desc: The budget orders that you assign to the campaign. This applies only to campaigns with a line-of-credit payment model. You can also use budget orders to manage how to spend your budget across multiple campaigns. This field is updatable.

items.name: countriesOrRegions
items.desc: The App Store geoterritories where you’re promoting your app. The default value is US. This field requires an alpha-2 country code value, such as US, for the locations you’re promoting to.The EQUALS, CONTAINS_ANY, and CONTAINS_ALL selector Condition operators are available to use with Find Campaigns.This field is updatable.

items.name: countryOrRegionServingStateReasons
items.desc: The map of reasons that returns when a campaign isn’t running.See CampaignCountryOrRegionsServingStateReasons for value descriptions.

items.name: dailyBudgetAmount
items.desc: Your daily spend cap. If you reach the daily spend cap, a campaign pauses for the remainder of the day.You can use the EQUALS, LESS_THAN, and GREATER_THAN selector Condition operators with Find Campaigns.This field is updatable.

items.name: deleted
items.desc: The indicator of whether the campaign is soft-deleted.You can use the EQUALS and IN selector Condition operators with Find Campaigns.

items.name: displayStatus
items.desc: The status of the campaign. The status resolves according to servingStatus and additional criteria.

items.name: endTime
items.desc: The scheduled end date and time for the ad group, which the system determines from the ad group with the latest end time in the campaign. If a campaign doesn’t have an ad group, the response is null.

items.name: id
items.desc: A unique identifier for the campaign that you can use as a campaignid in endpoint resources.You can use the EQUALS and IN selector Condition operators with Find Campaigns.

items.name: locInvoiceDetails
items.desc: The standard invoice details that you can set and edit using the LOCInvoiceDetails object.This field is updatable.

items.name: modificationTime
items.desc: The date and time of the most recent modification of the object.You can use the EQUALS, LESS_THAN, and GREATER_THAN selector Condition operators with Find Campaigns.

items.name: name
items.desc: The name of the campaign, which is unique within an organization.You can use the EQUALS, IN, and STARTSWITH selector Condition operators with Find Campaigns.This field is updatable.

items.name: orgId
items.desc: The identifier of the organization that owns the campaign. Your orgId is the same as your account in the Apple Search Ads UI.

items.name: paymentModel
items.desc: The payment model that you set through the Search Ads UI. If you don’t set a payment model, campaigns can’t run.See PaymentModel for value descriptions.If you don’t select a payment model, you can still create campaigns. You must select a payment model before a campaign is eligible to run.See BudgetOrder for details about setting a payment model.You can use the EQUALS and IN selector Condition operators with Find Campaigns.

items.name: servingStateReasons
items.desc: A list of reasons that displays when a campaign can’t run.See CampaignServingStateReasons for value descriptions.

items.name: servingStatus
items.desc: The status of the campaign.You can use the EQUALS and IN selector Condition operators with Find Campaigns.

items.name: startTime
items.desc: The scheduled start date and time for the campaign, which the system determines from the ad group with the earliest start time in the campaign. If a campaign doesn’t have an ad group, the response is null.You can use the EQUALS, LESS_THAN, and GREATER_THAN selector Condition operators with Find Campaigns.

items.name: status
items.desc: The user-controlled status to enable or pause the campaign.You can use the EQUALS and IN selector Condition operators with Find Campaigns.This field is updatable.

items.name: supplySources
items.desc: The location that an ad is shown in a campaign. See SupplySource for value descriptions.You can use the  EQUALS , CONTAINS_ANY, CONTAINS_ALL selector Condition operators with Find Campaigns.
